page.title: 12EDUCATION:SECONDARY
page.content: It is in the High School, however, where the greatest degree of change is reflected. {TWENTY YEARS AGO The school was then half its present size, (230 compared with 630), for this was before the new housing estates were built. There were then only 13 teachers: 2 women and 11 men. Subjects taught were English, Maths, History, Geography, Craft, R.E., Games, woodwork, art and cookery.. There were no foreign languages taught and the boys spent much of their time gardening. The school catchment area was as now, but only those from Ludham could come by bus and before that, others came by train and bicycle allowances were given. Pupils then entered the school at 11, having failed their 11-plus and left
